text: If you were using Dropbox's public folder feature, it stopped working earlier today, about five hours ago. The change was announced long in advance, but today was the day it actually stopped working. I was using the public folder of my Dropbox in a few of my apps. It was a great feature, a kind of interprocess communication for Everyman. I wish they had gone the other way and enhanced it, but I understand that it wasn't in their longterm direction. However it is important in my longterm direction. I'm working on a desktop product called Public Folder that does more or less what it used to do. I plan to share the product.
